result.execSummary:
All charges against Leon Anthony Murdo in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leon Anthony Murdo is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon Anthony Murdo

records.addlTxt: Defendant Leon A Murdo appeared by video, in custody from MMHI.  Attorney David Allan Nelson in court for Leon A Murdo.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr's report reviewed and findings are not contested.  State moves to administratively dismiss this case and defense joins in request.  Based on stipulation of the parties, Court finds defendant isn't likely to be restored to competency, and administratively closes case.
Arrangements made for def to appear by Zoom from Mendota for hearing on 10-14-22
References report from Dr Calas filed 9-30-22
from Dr Calas; confidential per Cover Sheet for Confidential Records filed 9-30-22
from Dr Johnson; Confidential per Cover Sheet for Confidential Records filed 8-9-22
References report from Dr Johnson filed 8-9-22
Notice of Assignment of Judge; insufficient address
Order on Petition for Appointment of Attorney; insufficient address
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) - to DA and counsel via efile, mailed to Sheriff and def, emailed to DHS.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leon A Murdo in court, in custody.  Attorney David Allan Nelson in court for Leon A Murdo. Counsel's first appearance. Case tagging w/22CF174.  Counsel raises competency issue in this case as well and req Court rely upon report in 22CF174; Court so orders and finds def not competent but likely to become competent w/in the statutory timeframe.  Court orders def committed to DHS for competency restoration. Court orders def into custody of Sheriff pending placement; Sheriff to transport def to institution identified by DHS.

Clerk: EZ.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leon Anthony Murdo in court, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Leon Anthony Murdo. (22CF174-Br. 4)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court notes the opinion of the psychologist in 22CF174 was just filed today.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Atty. de Junco states the defendant is not able to post cash bond in 22CF174 and unable to make an SPD evaluation.  Court appoints Atty David Nelson.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County as per 22CF174.  Court orders $500.00 signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
